documents.text:
--- Visit 1 | Date: 2025-06-08 ---

SB-P004 — Cycle 1, Day 1 visit.

Vital signs obtained: blood pressure 142/82, heart rate 57, weight 78.9 kg.

No new adverse events reported since last visit.

Lab panel results from today's draw:
  - PSA: 1.89 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0]
  - ALT: 25.41 U/L [ref 7.0-56.0]
  - AST: 14.14 U/L [ref 10.0-40.0]
  - Hemoglobin: 12.58 g/dL [ref 12.0-17.5]
  - WBC: 9.46 10^3/uL [ref 4.5-11.0]
  - Creatinine: 1.2 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3]

Continue study protocol. Monitor labs. Return visit 2 scheduled in 3 weeks.

--- Visit 2 | Date: 2025-06-29 ---

Follow-up visit #2 for patient SB-P004.

VS: 141/87 | HR 53 | Wt 84.2 kg. Patient well-nourished and in no acute distress.

No new adverse events reported since last visit.

Laboratory results:
  - PSA: 2.02 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0]
  - ALT: 23.87 U/L [ref 7.0-56.0]
  - AST: 12.94 U/L [ref 10.0-40.0]
  - Hemoglobin: 12.71 g/dL [ref 12.0-17.5]
  - WBC: 8.98 10^3/uL [ref 4.5-11.0]
  - Creatinine: 1.18 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3]

CT restaging shows partial response. Target lesions reduced significantly (49.0% decrease from baseline). No new lesions identified. RECIST: PR.

Serum PSA: 0.26 ng/mL, representing a decrease of 49.0% compared to baseline.

Assessment: Tolerating therapy. Plan to continue protocol. Next visit in 3 weeks.

--- Visit 3 | Date: 2025-07-20 ---

SB-P004 — Cycle 3, Day 1 visit.

Vitals: BP 151/66 mmHg, HR 80 bpm, Weight 80.5 kg.

Blood work results:
  - PSA: 1.76 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0]
  - ALT: 25.61 U/L [ref 7.0-56.0]
  - AST: 14.07 U/L [ref 10.0-40.0]
  - Hemoglobin: 12.13 g/dL [ref 12.0-17.5]
  - WBC: 8.67 10^3/uL [ref 4.5-11.0]
  - Creatinine: 1.27 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3]

Assessment: Tolerating therapy. Plan to continue protocol. Next visit in 3 weeks.

--- Visit 4 | Date: 2025-08-10 ---

Visit 4 clinical encounter for SB-P004.

Vitals: BP 113/86 mmHg, HR 80 bpm, Weight 58.7 kg.

No new adverse events reported since last visit.

Labs drawn today:
  - PSA: 0.96 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0]
  - ALT: 24.27 U/L [ref 7.0-56.0]
  - AST: 14.32 U/L [ref 10.0-40.0]
  - Hemoglobin: 11.92 g/dL [ref 12.0-17.5] (LOW)
  - WBC: 8.66 10^3/uL [ref 4.5-11.0]
  - Creatinine: 1.26 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3]

Imaging assessment (CT chest/abdomen/pelvis): Complete response — no measurable disease identified. All previously noted target lesions have resolved. Classified as CR per RECIST 1.1.

Serum PSA: 0.1 ng/mL, representing a decrease of 90.7% compared to baseline.

Assessment: Tolerating therapy. Plan to continue protocol. Next visit in 3 weeks.

--- Visit 5 | Date: 2025-08-31 ---

Scheduled visit 5 was not completed. patient reported feeling too unwell to travel to site.

--- Visit 6 | Date: 2025-09-21 ---

Patient SB-P004 presents for scheduled cycle 6 visit.

Vitals: BP 111/66 mmHg, HR 91 bpm, Weight 74.5 kg.

New AE: Vomiting. Severity: mild (Grade 1). Onset: day 121. Resolved with sequelae by day 124. Relatedness: definite. No dose modification required.

Labs drawn today:
  - PSA: 1.17 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0]
  - ALT: 28.0 U/L [ref 7.0-56.0]
  - AST: 16.48 U/L [ref 10.0-40.0]
  - Hemoglobin: 11.37 g/dL [ref 12.0-17.5] (LOW)
  - WBC: 8.3 10^3/uL [ref 4.5-11.0]
  - Creatinine: 1.35 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3] (HIGH)

Imaging assessment: Target lesion has increased by approximately 17.6% from nadir. Progressive disease (PD) per RECIST 1.1.

PSA now 0.59 ng/mL — increase 17.6% from initial value.

Continue study protocol. Monitor labs. Return visit 7 scheduled in 3 weeks.

--- Visit 7 | Date: 2025-10-12 ---

SB-P004 — Cycle 7, Day 1 visit.

VS: 112/87 | HR 77 | Wt 64.3 kg. Patient well-appearing, cooperative with exam.

No new adverse events reported since last visit.

Blood work results:
  - PSA: 1.35 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0]
  - ALT: 29.84 U/L [ref 7.0-56.0]
  - AST: 16.68 U/L [ref 10.0-40.0]
  - Hemoglobin: 11.66 g/dL [ref 12.0-17.5] (LOW)
  - WBC: 7.73 10^3/uL [ref 4.5-11.0]
  - Creatinine: 1.35 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3] (HIGH)

Plan: Continue current regimen. Follow up in 3 weeks.

--- Visit 8 | Date: 2025-11-02 ---

Follow-up visit #8 for patient SB-P004.

Vitals: BP 136/100 mmHg, HR 86 bpm, Weight 88.1 kg.

New AE: Headache. Severity: mild (Grade 1). Onset: day 167. Resolved by day 174. Relatedness: probable. Treatment was held pending resolution. Dose interruption documented.
Lab-confirmed anemia — Hemoglobin trending down. Grade 3 per CTCAE. Onset day 156. Currently ongoing. No dose modification required.

Blood work results:
  - PSA: 0.01 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0]
  - ALT: 29.61 U/L [ref 7.0-56.0]
  - AST: 16.24 U/L [ref 10.0-40.0]
  - Hemoglobin: 11.67 g/dL [ref 12.0-17.5] (LOW)
  - WBC: 7.59 10^3/uL [ref 4.5-11.0]
  - Creatinine: 1.34 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3] (HIGH)

Restaging CT shows stable disease. Target lesions within +/-15% of prior measurements. No new lesions. RECIST: SD.

Serum PSA: 0.48 ng/mL, representing a decrease of 5.0% compared to baseline.

Continue study protocol. Monitor labs. Return visit 9 scheduled in 3 weeks.
